description:
Seychelles confirmed the authorization for commercial flights to enter Seychelles as of August 1, 2020.

The new lift in air travel restrictions on the destination comes as an indication of the successful progression of the implementation of the first phase of movement restrictions effective as of June 1, 2020. UPDATE: The holiday destination confirmed the authorization for commercial flights to enter Seychelles as of August 1, 2020.

passengers or crew (except returning Seychellois residents) who have been to China in the last 14 days.

description: The list of Category 2 countries has been revised effective from November 16 and it includes France, UK, Switzerland, Germany, Austria, UAE and Italy. Visitors from these countries can still come to Seychelles but they have to do a PCR test 48 hours or less before arrival and they have to book in Category 2 establishments. After five days a PCR test will be done and if it is negative they can continue their stay in the same place under certain conditions or move to a Category 1 establishment.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Employers that intend to retain the services of foreign workers with a Gainful Occupation Permit (GOP) who are currently outside of Seychelles due to closed borders have to inform the employment department by June 30
type_text: Essentially, there are foreign workers in Seychelles who work under a Gainful Occupation Permit (GOP). This allows the holder to be gainfully occupied in Seychelles and this could be as an employee or as a self‐employed person. Employers who want to continue employing these workers, need to notify the employment department by June 30.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Seychelles, March 2nd 2020. Organisers of large public gatherings are being advised to cancel and postpone the event until further notice

Seychelles advises that organisers of large public events must cancel or postpone their events on 2March2020. UPDATE: In Seychelles, religious services, including funeral services, will be able to resume following guidance from the Department of Health beginning 4 May

Seychelles advises that organisers of large public events must cancel or postpone their events on 2March2020. UPDATE: In Seychelles gyms, cinemas, bars and casino can reopen beginning June 1, in line with guidance from the Department of Health.

Seychelles advises entertainment venues likes cinemas and fun fairs to cancel all events. Religious organisations also advised to limit contact during activities from March 18 onwards. UPDATE: The advice limiting public gathering expanded to religious organisations and enetertainment venues like cinemas from 18 March onwards.

The sports council in Seychelles will make available facilities for competitions beginning 1 June. If they cannot satisfy the criteria set by the Department of Health they will have to organize their competitions without spectators. The regulations say training can only resume in small groups.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of a recreational or commercial event
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Social distancing measures are enforced in Seychelles from 22 March onwards.
Seychelles order construction companies to cease work as part of social distancing measures on 7 April 2020.
